title: Waisea Luveniyali
text:
Waisea Sedre Luveniyali (born <a href="Suva">Suva</a>, 23 July 1985) is a <a href="Fiji">Fiji</a>an <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> footballer. He hails from the village of Kasavu in the province of <a href="Naitasiri%20Province">Naitasiri</a>, and his mother is from the village of Qarani, Gau in the <a href="Lomaiviti%20%28Fijian%20Communal%20Constituency%2C%20Fiji%29">Lomaiviti</a> group.
Career.
He plays as a <a href="Fly-half%20%28rugby%20union%29">fly-half</a>, formerly for <a href="Fiji%20Warriors">Fiji Warriors</a>.
Luveniyali was a late call up to the Fijian team in 2007 after playing for Fiji in the Under 21 World Cup. The young fly half was put right into the starting lineup to debut against <a href="Australia%20A%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Australia A</a>, where they drew the game 14 – 14. After this performance, he was selected for the <a href="Fiji%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Fiji</a> for the <a href="2007%20Rugby%20World%20Cup">2007 Rugby World Cup</a> finals. He played against <a href="Australia%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Australia</a> (12–55). He had 2 caps, with a conversion and a penalty scored by the end of the tournament.
He was the first choice fly-half for Fiji in the <a href="2008%20IRB%20Pacific%20Nations%20Cup">2008 IRB Pacific Nations Cup</a> and played in the <a href="2009%20IRB%20Pacific%20Nations%20Cup">2009 IRB Pacific Nations Cup</a>.
Harlequins.
On 29 July 2008, <a href="Harlequin%20F.C.">Harlequins</a> confirmed that he had arrived in London to join up with his new team and had started training.
